title: Practical Navigation
description: Covers celestial and coastal navigation, including the use of charts, position fixing, tides, and passage planning to ensure safe and efficient voyages.

title: Ship Construction and Stability
description: Provides an understanding of ship structures, stability principles, buoyancy, stresses, and the safe loading and ballasting of vessels.

title: Meteorology
description: Introduces weather systems, atmospheric pressure, wind patterns, tropical storms, and the interpretation of meteorological data for safe navigation.

title: Cargo Work
description: Focuses on cargo handling, stowage, securing, ventilation, and the precautions necessary for the safe carriage of various types of cargoes.

title: Magnetism, Electricity, and Gyro-Compass
description: Explains the principles of magnetism and electricity as applied to ships, including the use and care of magnetic and gyro compasses for navigation.

title: Maritime Legislation
description: Reviews international and national maritime laws, conventions, and regulations governing ship operations, safety, and environmental protection.

title: Convention on the International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972 (COLREGs)
description: Provides knowledge and understanding of the rules and regulations established to prevent collisions at sea, including navigation lights, shapes, sound signals, and the responsibilities of vessels under various conditions.

title: IALA Maritime Buoyage System
description: Introduces the International Association of Marine Aids to Navigation and Lighthouse Authorities (IALA) buoyage system, covering buoy types, marks, colors, and their meanings for safe navigation.

title: Electronic Navigation Aids
description: Covers the use and interpretation of electronic navigation systems such as radar, ARPA, GPS, echo sounders, and AIS for safe and effective ship navigation.

title: Engineering Knowledge
description: Provides a basic understanding of shipboard machinery, propulsion systems, auxiliary equipment, and essential engineering practices relevant to deck officers.
